definition: to evaporate/(of cooking) to steam/torch made from hemp stalks or bamboo (old)/finely chopped firewood (old)

sentences.english: The constable in town has a steam engine.
sentences.chinese: 鎮裏的治安官有一臺蒸汽機。

sentences.english: But a steam locomotive is a Shandong warrior.
sentences.chinese: 而蒸汽機車卻是山東綠林中的武士”。

sentences.english: The result of invention of steam engine was that human power was replaced by mechanical power.
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽機發明的結果是機械動力代替了人力。

sentences.english: An antique steam locomotive has been displaying at Nürnberg Eisenbahn Museum.
sentences.chinese: 展示於德國紐倫堡鐵路博物館中的古董蒸汽機車。

sentences.english: SL 357 was firing by burning wood.
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽機車357號以木材爲燃料升火鳴笛。

sentences.english: The steam locomotives were superseded by diesel units.
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽機車已被柴油內燃機車所取代。

sentences.english: And though much is made of the steam engine, ice scarcely merits a mention.
sentences.chinese: 加之儘管蒸汽機制成了許多東西，但冰簡直不值一提。

sentences.english: Steam railways had their heyday in the 19th century .
sentences.chinese: 19世紀是蒸汽機車的全盛時期。

sentences.english: The two-cylinder double-acting pump is powered by a 2-cylinder steam engine.
sentences.chinese: 兩缸雙作用泵的動力裝置爲2缸蒸汽機。

sentences.english: In 1941, the train would have been pulled by a steam engine.
sentences.chinese: 1941年，火車本可以由蒸汽機車拉動。

sentences.english: The early steam engines were of the piston-type.
sentences.chinese: 早期的蒸汽機屬於活塞型。
“蒸汽機”這個詞聽起來怪怪的。

sentences.english: In Newcomen’s engine, however, the process was extremely inefficient.
sentences.chinese: 然而，紐科門的蒸汽機效率極其低下。

sentences.english: High-powered steamboats began to carry goods and passengers on rivers and seas.
sentences.chinese: 高能蒸汽機船開始在內河和海上運載貨物和旅客。

sentences.english: The 19th century was the heyday of steam railways.
sentences.chinese: 19世紀是蒸汽機車鼎盛的時代。

sentences.english: Some more models of steam locomotives of the early period.
sentences.chinese: 早起的蒸汽機車的模型。

definition: to shut down (a factory)/to close a facility/a lockout
Leonardo da Vinci (1452-1519), Italian Renaissance painter (Tw)
global warming (PRC usage)/written 全球暖化 in Taiwan
